ghs_data.descriptive_name: 2-Ethoxyethyl acetate; Ethylene glycol monoethyl ether acetate

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 51.1degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2003) which is classified into Category 3. Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group III (UN#1172) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 379degC (ICSC, 2003)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1172)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 2,700mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 2, 2003).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Because the LC50 value (4 hours) of 24.2mg/L (4,470ppm), calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (8 hour inhalation exposure) of 12.1mg/L (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)), exceeded the saturated vapour concentration (3,080ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 2.34mmHg (25degC), the substance was hence not classified based on standard values of mist.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-68 (2002)): The results of 24-hour application suggest "mild irritation" of the skin, though those of 4-hour application are not available.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "mild irritation" from rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Data 2001-68 (2002)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-68 (2002) and NTP DB (Access on December 2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rat teratogenicity studies (CERI Hazard Data 2001-68 (2002)): Visceral malformations (cardiac, umbilical cord malformations) and skeletal malformation (symphysis, undulated ribs) are observed in the embryo at dose levels not toxic to the dam.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including adverse effects on the testes and kidneys. The amount of exposure, however, is not applicable to the dosage that can be classified; the toxicity within the range of the classification is unknown.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96 hours LC50=40mg/L of the fish (Grunion) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 86.9% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.59 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
